I think "bewildered by default" is, in fact, the best way of thinking about user modelling and most tech decision making as of VR's arrival.
But right now I just feel that we're in mid-stage disconnect as the baseline rate of change starts to leave people bewildered by default.
Note that we have no capacity in the ecosystem to handle these kinds of problems. Maybe it's in Silicon Valley around @ ramez and the lads.
But I think that the jagged edge is much nearer and more ragged than that. I think the blundering anti-biotech regulation landscape is close
Of course, the Singularitarians have a variety of emotional dodges to get out of this mess: benevolent AI, or some kind of deep tolerance.
Two way that can work out. Ordinary people sabotage that future by regulation (VR) and pitchforks (AI), or they become our pets. Bad outcome

If I stretch the brain far enough to integrate what's happening, I fly too high to be able to relate to most of the human race. No bridge.
